channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipping in Duncroft Park hedge near alleyway to Barnett Way, 23rd April
item.description:
Several laminated boards have been dumped in the hedge, please remove - Duncroft Park, Hucclecote, Gloucester

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 18c Ley Court Barnett Way, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ruined road verge, 23rd April
item.description:
Outside 88 Lansdown Road, GL51 6QR (A40) CBC planning ref. 21/02526/FUL Outside building site (hoardings to site visible in attached photo) - verge has been ruined by builders vehicles parking on it. Deep ruts, sea of mud. Verge on opposite side of road also damaged to lesser extent also by builders vehicles. Highways and/or CBC need to ensure the developer makes good the damage they have caused.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 88 Lansdown Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lighting is out in the whole area.please turn it back on, 23rd April
item.description:
The street lights are out in the whole area its vry dark and scary
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 25 Rowanfield Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Streetlights not working, 22nd April
item.description:
Street lights aren't working around the green/by shop
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 19 Lynworth Place, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive, car swallowing, gaping chasms in road, 22nd April
item.description:
Potholes been here for decades. Patched up. More holes. Patched up. More to replace. The local resident troll likes to stamp its feet in this particular spot to relieve its rotting athletes foot, hence the recurring nature. I’ve been catapulted through the air multiple times when driving to work and my poor car hits a troll footprint. Many car lives lost to these gigantic cave like potholes. I heard that the council are considering making them a national park as they’re so mountainous now. Simple solution would be to build roads down into and out of the other side of the potholes, they’re that wide and deep. If driving this road, seriously consider only doing so in an off roading vehicle, or a tank. They’re the only things to survive the attack.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Greenway Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Millions of potholes. Meteor strike caused multiple craters., 22nd April
item.description:
Potholes been here since a meteor storm. Reported countless times. We now have a nice sign to alert to the damage about to be inflicted on car/bike/motorbike/van/legs/life from the council as a gift but still no action to rectify the issue. Numerous lives lost in the deepest darkest depths. Abandoned vehicles strewn all around the vicinity, teetering precariously on the precipice of impending doom as people attempt to avoid their fate of falling into one of these chasms. Council gives zero shits and refuse to fix. Will be refusing to pay my road tax to risk my life daily.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 4 West End Lane, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Every single Streetlight in Marsh Lane is not working, 22nd April
item.description:
All the Streetlights in Marsh Lane, Cheltenham have stopped working in the last 24 hours.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 12 Marsh Lane, Cheltenham

item.title: Right filter lane vehicle detection, 20th April
item.description:
The right filter lane isn't detecting vehicles waiting to turn right into Old Cheltenham Rd. You can sit there waiting with no other vehicles approaching the junction in any other direction for what feels like a long time.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 198 Cheltenham Road, Elmbridge
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes here and there in Tobyfield Road, 20th April
item.description:
There are potholes along this part of Tobyfield Road that need repairing. As I said before they are everywhere. It is a disgrace when so much revenue must be taken for road tax with all of the cars on the roads today.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 11 Tobyfield Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Potholes all along Kayte Lane, 20th April
item.description:
There are potholes all along Kayte Lane that need fixing. When driving through Bishops Cleeve one zig zags across the road to try and avoid them all and not damage the wheels or suspension of the car.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 53 Kayte Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road breaking up plus potholes, 20th April
item.description:
The edge of the road is breaking up by the pavement near the Swallow. It is a huge channel along the edge of the pavement, apart from the potholes. The roads in Bishops Cleeve are shocking with potholes everywhere
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 84 Bishops Drive, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
